about_the_game:
Kinetic Anatomy 3D offers a wealth of 3D animation demonstrations of human muscle and skeletal movements, allowing users to study anatomy efficiently and is suitable for teaching demonstrations within a certain scope. The demo version includes module of some basic kinematic movements of human joints. Kinetic Anatomy 3D employs a list-based structure point selection control strategy, enabling users to select anatomical structures either in the 3D view or in the list. The software also features the ability to save custom presets and custom groupings, making it very user-friendly.
The 3D rendering of Kinetic Anatomy 3D is based on the open-source Godot engine, ensuring the safety and controllability of the development process.
